@Jenny_Odegard @johnthelawyer I guess law-practice and legal-tech are just fundamentally different. *shrugs*
@Jenny_Odegard @johnthelawyer I get that, but I'm saying that after years of hiring, arbitrary screens dont help me find *better* candidates
@johnthelawyer @Jenny_Odegard As the employer, why make hiring harder for candidates? I've been a hiring manager for years, don't get it.
@johnthelawyer @Jenny_Odegard And I certainly don't expect them to answer trivia. A job is just a job, not a talent show.
@johnthelawyer @Jenny_Odegard it's pretty hard to jump through *everyone's* different hoops. I'm not offended if an applicant flubs a letter
@johnthelawyer @Jenny_Odegard I'm guessing y'all haven't applied for a job in a while; when you're sending out *hundreds* of cover letters..
@chezrebellion @MMazanec22 @aidanfeldman again, it doesn't work that way. Not to be pedantic but it's not "investing" its paying for things.

*waves from DC* not for everyone, @SenFranken Please remember this when our Statehood bill comes back. https://t.co/Mu3C9JOdJU
@MMazanec22 @chezrebellion @aidanfeldman Totally agree. I'm just pointing out that you can't compare apples and oranges. NY != OH != KS
@chezrebellion @aidanfeldman I spent years working this data for FTA, it's not so straightforward as "states pay for it".
@chezrebellion @aidanfeldman state money is only part of transit income; federal, local, and revenue also count; agencies are locally run.
@waldojaquith @pcrickard Yup, that's the one.
